arm_group.description: after manipulation and reduction were performed by single emergency medicine specialist under Bier block regional anesthesia or procedural sedation-analgesia, The ultrasonography was performed by the single emergency department physician in a long axis both in a anterioposterior and lateral views in determining whether the distal and proximal distal to a fracture was in a straight line (less than 3 mm difference) or not?

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether ultrasonography guidance compare with the
      simple radiography aids in determining the adequacy of distal radius fracture reduction.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Validity of Ultrasonography in Determining Distal Radius Fracture Reduction

detailed_description.textblock:
Distal radius fracture is one of the most common causes for visiting the emergency
      department. Nowadays, simple radiography is used as a control standard for evaluating
      reduction of distal radius fractures. The disadvantages include time wasting, frequent x-ray
      exposures and use of more sedation in determining adequate reduction, made scientists to
      evaluate alternative method such as  ultrasonography  which fast, easy and less dangerous
      were considered as advantages. The investigators goal was to identify whether
      ultrasonography guidance compare with the simple radiography aids in determining the
      adequacy of distal radius fracture reduction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  > 21 years old and a diagnosing of a distal radius fracture based on simple
             radiography.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Open fractures

          -  more than 20 degree angulation

          -  joint internal involvement, communicated and along with Neurovascular compromised
             fractures

          -  patient's surgery due to other causes

          -  need to stay in the ICU and not being able to be treated at the same time for distal
             radius fracture

          -  patient's refusal to participate in the study

intervention.description: after manipulation and reduction were performed by single emergency medicine specialist under Bier block regional anesthesia or procedural sedation-analgesia, The ultrasonography was performed by the single emergency department physician in a long axis both in a anterioposterior and lateral views in determining whether the distal and proximal distal to a fracture was in a straight line (less than 3 mm difference) or not?

clinical_study.official_title: Study of Accuracy of Ultrasonography in Determining the Adequacy of Distal Radius Fracture Reduction

primary_outcome.description: after manipulation and reduction were performed by single emergency medicine specialist under Bier block regional anesthesia or procedural sedation-analgesia, The ultrasonography was performed  by the single emergency department physician in a long axis both in a anterioposterior and lateral views in determining whether the distal and proximal distal to a fracture was in a straight line (less than 3 mm difference) or not?
primary_outcome.measure: adequacy of distal radius fracture reduction
